comment: Professor Kirwan gives really good explanations during his lectures and always gave us time to ask questions. homework on aleks can get a bit frustrating at times but it wasnt too bad for me. the problem comes down to his exams, each had only 12 questions and they felt like everything that I spent time studying didnt show up on the exam.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Don't take his class if you dont want to spend 6-10 hours a week on math. ALEKS program heavy, homework is on ALEKS. Attendance is not mandatory, but if you want to pass, you should attend. Tough grader. Other students in Math 1111 heard that their professor let them have a notecard with anything written down. Teaches like ChatGPT. no extra credit

Once you can adapt to the grading practices in Dr. Kirwan's class, and focus on learning as your goal, the class becomes much less stressful. Dr. Kirwan is a good lecturer and knows his content well. He takes math down to the minute level to teach conceptually but then adds valuable teaching tips. He gives timely feedback and allows corrections.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: One of my favorite math professors. He is organized, clearly knows what he is teaching, and super open-minded. He provides many practice explanations so you know what to expect on quizzes. There is definitely a learning curve with getting adjusted to the way he grades, but he is always happy to give help and feedback.

Not like any other professor I've had before. All of your grades come from EQ's, either in class alone or with your group, take home quizzes, and the final. Everything grade wise is structured the same, a 1-5 grading scale. Always has a practice explanation for homework after each class that is due at the next class. Not the best, not the worst.

Hands down one the best teachers I have ever had. Organized, prepared and cares. This class taught me to think critically and to develop a clearer understanding of math. Put in the work and the hard work will pay off. This is one of the best teachers at KSU .
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this professor the previous semester, and I can say that he took our feedback from last semester and improved himself. He tried to make his expectations more clear and he graded our assignments easier. Dr. K is very intelligent and really tries to understand how his students process knowledge to effectively give feedback.

I hated this class. Not because of the material, but because of the grading system. I've never spent so much time on an assignment and really felt confident in my work just to find out the work I submitted was worth an F. The professors grading is a little ridiculous. He's the only professor teaching this, which really sucks cause he was awful.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This professor is difficult but he honestly works with you and wants you to succeed. Take each assignment one bit at a time and give yourself plenty of time to complete the assignments. He also will answer any questions you have as you go just email him! Take him and just put in some effort and you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class will seem overwhelming at the beginning and the grading is tough from the get go, but Kirwan really cares about his class and will do what it takes to help you learn and improve. By the end, you will see a great improvement in your own work.

Tough course based on math theory. Must go to class, participation and EQs for grades. PSAs and take home quizzes are graded hard. He will only give so much info, bc he wants you to figure things out. It can be frustrating.  Better at 1 on 1, I went to office hour to review my work and it helped alot and he changed 2 quiz grades and a PSA grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Challenges you to think about the "why" behind mathematical concepts (why 2+24). Homework every night; helps prepare you for the next class. You are given a problem to work through in groups, and you spend the class understanding the underlying math operations. Attendance mandatory; quizzes and PSAs are very hard and but you can take them home.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tough Grader

comment: His class goes very slow. He will let you read the chapter which he is goon to teach before class. he likes us to discuss in group, but that doesn't really help. He is very nice and would like to help you if you need. He responses to students' emails and encourages us to email him about questions. For me, Dr Kirwan is a nice choice.

Avoid this professor if u can. Makes math more complicated thn it needs to be. Quiz every wk for previous weeks work when your brain is over loaded with the current wks lesson. Takes points off for every lil mistake. Explains math like he is talking to other math prof's. Makes u define math terms in your own words thn deducts pts if not exact.

DO NOT take his class for College Algebra 1111. Everything you learn will not be on his tests. Don't let him mess up your GPA, especially you guys in fraternities/sororities, don't get on academic probation because of this terrible teacher.

I would NOT recommend taking this professor. Although he is very intelligent and knows the material, he does not know how to communicate with normal students. Attendance matters. Takes points off for phone. No notes. Group work every day. Quiz every other class for the most part. He is a nice guy and the work isn't difficult, he just doesn't teach!

This class is really hard if you aren't a math person. He explains stuff in ways that was tough to understand. He gives you worksheets and expects you to be able to do it without teaching it to you first. He constantly has you get into your small groups, so it is basically a self taught class. I recommend you find a different and better teacher.

If you took algebra in Highschool, its an easy A. If not, i wouldnt recomend him. Honestly my roommate online shops during his class and has A. There's a lot of group work, quizzes every other class for the most part, but they're easy. He can be hard to understand sometimes, but always will help when needed. Asking questions is good.

Do not take his class if you are not a math person! He does not make things clear and does not teach. Has us work in groups the whole time to teach ourselves. I was forced to drop this class because of him. Do not do it!
He does not help you whatsoever. No notes only worksheets. He's awful don't waste your time on him or his class
